chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (A : Type) (a b : A) (R : rel A A), R a b -> let f := fun x y : A * A => (inr (fst x), inl (snd y)) in Monotonic f (R * ⊤ ++> ⊤ * R ++> (⊥ + R) * (R + ⊥))

Premises:
rel = fun A1 A2 : Type => A1 -> A2 -> Prop : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments rel (_ _)%type_scope
snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments snd {A B}%type_scope
Inductive sum (A B : Type) : Type := inl : A -> A + B | inr : B -> A + B Arguments sum (_ _)%type_scope Arguments inl {A B}%type_scope, [A] _ _ Arguments inr {A B}%type_scope, _ [B] _
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments T
Fin.R : forall n : nat, Fin.t ?m -> Fin.t (n + ?m) where ?m : [ |- nat]
Notation Monotonic m R := (@ Monotonic _ m R)
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments fst {A B}%type_scope
Unnamed_thm2 : forall (A : Type) (a b : A) (R : rel A A) (f : A -> A) (p : A -> Prop), Monotonic f (R ++> R) -> Monotonic p (R --> impl) -> R a b -> p (f b) -> p (f a)
Unnamed_thm1 : forall (A : Type) (a b : A) (R : relation A), Equivalence R -> R a b -> (R + R)%rel (inl a) (inl b)
Record div_theory (R : Type) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cadd cmul : C -> C -> C) (phi : C -> R) (cdiv : C -> C -> C * C) : Prop := mkdiv_th { div_eucl_th : forall a b : C, let (q, r) := cdiv a b in req (phi a) (phi (cadd (cmul b q) r)) } Arguments Ring_theory.div_theory [R]%type_scope _%function_scope [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Ring_theory.mkdiv_th [R]%type_scope _%function_scope [C]%type_scope (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope
rel_top_equiv = fun A : Type => {| Equivalence_Reflexive := fun _ : A => I; Equivalence_Symmetric := fun (x y : A) (_ : ⊤ x y) => I; Equivalence_Transitive := fun (x y z : A) (_ : ⊤ x y) (_ : ⊤ y z) => I |} : forall A : Type, Equivalence ⊤ Arguments rel_top_equiv {A}%type_scope
set_le_subrel = fun (A B : Type) (R1 R2 : rel A B) (HR : subrel R1 R2) (sA : A -> Prop) (sB : B -> Prop) (Hs : set_le R1 sA sB) (x : A) (Hx : sA x) => let e : exists b : B, (sB b /\ R1 x b)%type := Hs x Hx in match e with | ex_intro _ y (conj Hy Hxy) => ex_intro (fun b : B => (sB b /\ R2 x b)%type) y (conj Hy (HR x y Hxy)) end : forall A B : Type, Monotonic set_le (subrel ++> subrel) Arguments set_le_subrel {A B}%type_scope
set_le = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (sA : A -> Prop) (sB : B -> Prop) => forall a : A, sA a -> exists b : B, (sB b /\ R a b)%type : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> rel (A -> Prop) (B -> Prop) Arguments set_le {A B}%type_scope _%rel_scope
set_ge = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (sA : A -> Prop) (sB : B -> Prop) => forall b : B, sB b -> exists a : A, (sA a /\ R a b)%type : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> rel (A -> Prop) (B -> Prop) Arguments set_ge {A B}%type_scope _%rel_scope
Transport = fun (A B : Type) (R : rel A B) (a : A) (b : B) (PA PB : Prop) => R a b -> PA -> PB : forall A B : Type, rel A B -> A -> B -> Prop -> Prop -> Prop Arguments Transport {A B}%type_scope _%rel_scope _ _ (_ _)%type_scope
sum_rec : forall (A B : Type) (P : A + B -> Set), (forall a : A, P (inl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inr b)) -> forall s : A + B, P s
sum_ind : forall (A B : Type) (P : A + B -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (inl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inr b)) -> forall s : A + B, P s
sum_rect : forall (A B : Type) (P : A + B -> Type), (forall a : A, P (inl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inr b)) -> forall s : A + B, P s
sum_sind : forall (A B : Type) (P : A + B -> SProp), (forall a : A, P (inl a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inr b)) -> forall s : A + B, P s
Relation_Operators.le_AsB_sind : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (P : A + B -> A + B -> SProp), (forall x y : A, leA x y -> P (inl x) (inl y)) -> (forall (x : A) (y : B), P (inl x) (inr y)) -> (forall x y : B, leB x y -> P (inr x) (inr y)) -> forall s s0 : A + B, Relation_Operators.le_AsB A B leA leB s s0 -> P s s0
Relation_Operators.le_AsB_ind : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (P : A + B -> A + B -> Prop), (forall x y : A, leA x y -> P (inl x) (inl y)) -> (forall (x : A) (y : B), P (inl x) (inr y)) -> (forall x y : B, leB x y -> P (inr x) (inr y)) -> forall s s0 : A + B, Relation_Operators.le_AsB A B leA leB s s0 -> P s s0
prod_subrel = fun (A1 A2 B1 B2 : Type) (x y : rel A1 A2) (H : subrel x y) (x0 y0 : rel B1 B2) (H0 : subrel x0 y0) (x1 : A1 * B1) (y1 : A2 * B2) (H1 : (x * x0)%rel x1 y1) => and_ind (fun (H2 : x (fst x1) (fst y1)) (H3 : x0 (snd x1) (snd y1)) => conj ((fun H4 : forall y2 : B2, x0 (let (_, y3) := x1 in y3) y2 -> y0 (let (_, y3) := x1 in y3) y2 => (fun H5 : x0 (let (_, y2) := x1 in y2) (let (_, y2) := y1 in y2)...
set_ge_subrel = fun (A B : Type) (x y : rel A B) (H : subrel x y) (x0 : A -> Prop) (y0 : B -> Prop) (H0 : set_ge x x0 y0) (b : B) (H1 : y0 b) => (fun H2 : y0 b -> exists a : A, (x0 a /\ x a b)%type => (fun H3 : exists a : A, (x0 a /\ x a b)%type => ex_ind (fun (x1 : A) (H4 : x0 x1 /\ x x1 b) => and_ind (fun (H5 : x0 x1) (H6 : x x1 b) => ex_intro (fun a : A => (x0 a /\ y a b)%type) x1 (conj H5 ((fun _ : forall y1 : B, x x1 y1 -> y x1 y1 => H x...
Related = fun (A B : Type) (f : A) (g : B) (R : rel A B) => R f g : forall A B : Type, A -> B -> rel A B -> Prop Arguments Related {A B}%type_scope _ _ _%rel_scope
split_nth : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (n : nat) (d : A * B), nth n l d = (nth n (fst (split l)) (fst d), nth n (snd (split l)) (snd d))
prod_ind : forall (A B : Type) (P : A * B -> Prop), (forall (a : A) (b : B), P (a, b)) -> forall p : A * B, P p
Ring_polynom.MPcond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> list R -> Prop
in_split_r : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (p : A * B), In p l -> In (snd p) (snd (split l))
Refl.make_impl_map : forall (A B : Type) (eval : A -> Prop) (eval' : A * B -> Prop) (l : list (A * B)) (r : Prop), (forall x : A * B, eval' x <-> eval (fst x)) -> Refl.make_impl eval' l r < -> Refl.make_impl eval (map fst l) r
Coreflexive = fun (A : Type) (R : relation A) => forall x y : A, R x y -> x = y : forall A : Type, relation A -> Prop Arguments Coreflexive {A}%type_scope _%rel_scope
prod_rel = fun (A1 A2 B1 B2 : Type) (RA : A1 -> A2 -> Prop) (RB : B1 -> B2 -> Prop) (x1 : A1 * B1) (x2 : A2 * B2) => (RA (fst x1) (fst x2) /\ RB (snd x1) (snd x2))%type : forall A1 A2 B1 B2 : Type, (A1 -> A2 -> Prop) -> (B1 -> B2 -> Prop) -> rel (A1 * B1) (A2 * B2) Arguments prod_rel {A1 A2 B1 B2}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope
in_split_l : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (p : A * B), In p l -> In (fst p) (fst (split l))

```coq
intros A a b R H.
unfold Monotonic.
intros x y Hxy.
destruct x as [x1 x2].
destruct y as [y1 y2].
simpl in *.
destruct Hxy as [Hxy1 Hxy2].
rewrite <- Hxy1.
rewrite <- Hxy2.
apply set_le_subrel with (sA := fun _ => True) (sB := fun _ => True).
- intros; exists y1; split; auto.
- intros; exists x2; split; auto.
- apply Unnamed_thm2 with (p := fun _ => True); auto.
Qed.

original: intros A a b R H. unfold Monotonic. intros x y Hxy. destruct x as [x1 x2]. destruct y as [y1 y2]. simpl in *. destruct Hxy as [Hxy1 Hxy2]. rewrite <- Hxy1. rewrite <- Hxy2. apply set_le_subrel with (sA := fun _ => True) (sB := fun _ => True). - intros; exists y1; split; auto. - intros; exists x2; split; auto. - apply Unnamed_thm2 with (p := fun _ => True); auto.
